citation.title: Giraffe: Using Deep Reinforcement Learning to Play Chess

news.title: New Computer Learns How to Play Expert-Level Chess in Just 72 Hours
news.summary: It’s been nearly two decades since computers have been able to beat the best human chess players.

news.title: Selbstlernende KI: Neuer Schachcomputer spielt auf Profi-Niveau
news.summary: Eine Künstliche Intelligenz untersucht und bewertet die Stellungen von Schachfiguren auf dem Spielbrett.

news.title: Schachcomputer bringt sich das Spielen bei
news.summary: Eine Künstliche Intelligenz untersucht und bewertet die Stellungen von Schachfiguren auf dem Spielbrett.

news.title: Deep Learning Machine Teaches Itself Chess in 72 Hours, Plays at International Master Level | MIT Technology Review
news.summary: It’s been almost 20 years since IBM’s Deep Blue supercomputer beat the reigning world chess champion, Gary Kasparov, for the first time under standard tournament rules.

news.title: An AI computer learned how to beat almost anyone at chess in 72 hours
news.summary: The computer’s domination over humanity may start at the chessboard. Since IBM’s Deep Blue beat chess master Garry Kasparov in 1997—the first time a computer beat a human at chess under tournament rules—computers have gotten faster and faster.

news.title: Artificial Intelligence Is Taking Computer Chess Beyond Brute Force
news.summary: Chess is often seen as the ultimate mental challenge: 32 pieces on an 8-by-8 board, and nearly limitless possible moves.

news.title: Este 'software' aprende ajedrez como un maestro en tres días
news.summary: Juega contra sí mismo miles de partidas utilizando 'deep learning', creando algo similar a la intuición de una persona para decidir cuál es la mejor jugada Un investigador canadiense ha creado un sistema de inteligencia artificial que, aprendiendo…

news.title: Künstliche Intelligenz In drei Tagen zum Internationalen Schachmeister
news.summary: 17. September 2015, 17:01 Uhr In drei Tagen zum Internationalen Schachmeister Von Richard Meusers Wer war noch gleich Deep Blue? Ein Forscher hat eine künstliche Intelligenz namens Giraffe entwickelt, die sich selbstständig das Spielen beibringt.

news.title: AI Learns Chess In Just Three Days, Now Plays Equivalent To International Grandmaster Level
news.summary: What makes the Giraffe AI different from other chess-playing program is that it learns which of the moves work.

news.title: New AI learns to play chess at international grandmaster level in 72 hours
news.summary: An artificially intelligent (AI) machine has taught itself to play chess better than most humans in just three days.

news.title: AI System Achieves Chess Greatness within 72 Hours
news.summary: We’ve written about artificial intelligence programs participating in a number of competitions typically won with sharp human minds.

q&a.title: How to teach neural network a policy for a board game using reinforcement learning?
q&a.summary:
I need to use reinforcement learning to teach a neural net a policy for a board game. I chose Q-learining as the specific alghoritm.

I'd like a neural net to have the following structure:


layer - rows * cols + 1 neurons - input - values of consecutive f
